item.title: About
item.description:
I am a MSc of joined Computer Science and Math. I enjoy libre software. Living in Wrocław, Poland. Come see this beautiful city and have a beer with me!

Security bugs portfolio

  • CVE-2023-2234 (RCE in Zephyr BT HCI)
  • CVE-2024-34083 (NOSTARTTLS in aiosmtpd)

Nerd Stuff

The posts on this blog are licensed under the Creative Commons BY-SA 4.0 license. I built this blog using Hugo, markdown, PaperMod, and SourceHut Pages. You can take a look at the source if you’re curious as to how it works. There is no support for comments on this blog, as all its pages are statically generated; if you truly feel compelled to comment, there are many news aggregators that provide you with such a space.

item.title: Contact
item.description:
The best way to contact me is to send me an email: blog at arusekk.pl. I reply after a week at most. If it does not work, try arek_koz at o2.pl.

You can find me also on Matrix (@Arusekk:matrix.org) and Discord (@Arusekk#6609). I sometimes lag more on those, but if you are lucky and catch me online, we can talk with the least ping.

item.title: Blogroll
item.description:
I love the idea of personal blogging. If you know any search engine that only includes genuine blogs by actual people and excludes all the new-age auto-generated content, advertisements, social media posts and low-effort journalists, please let me know.

Here is a blogroll of my friends (if you feel left out, reach out!):

  • Franciszek Malinka (feed)
  • Disconnect3d (feed)
  • BonusPlay
  • Radosław Miernik (feed)

… and some other blogs I found nice:

item.title: Polish English one
item.description: A nice quirk I found about Polish/English translation

item.title: Facebook messenger custom reactions
item.description: You can react with custom reactions on Facebook Messenger and here's how

item.title: Tech vs religion
item.description: It is 2023 already, and religion, to the dismay of many, still holds on tight.

item.title: Rant on TLS PKI
item.description: There are some fundamental design flaws in X.509 / WebPKI (HTTPS/TLS key infrasructure), and I am freaked out nobody has noticed. Or have they?

item.title: Die, IPv4, just die already!!!1!
item.description: IPv4 is obsolete and has no future. Just deal with it. IPv6 is the way to go.

item.title: My domain is my castle
item.description: I spent many many days learing how everything domain-related works, and here are my thoughts and the least intuitive facts.

item.title: Average day of a FLOSS developer
item.description: It feels fun to be part of a nice phenomenon.

item.title: Thoughts on opinions
item.description: Why believing the wrong opinion could make your life cursed.

item.title: An adventure with Acer Swift
item.description: A story of a new laptop and hard obstacles in the way of getting it to work

item.title: I translated Git!
item.description: Linguistic digressions on how hard it is to translate stuff

item.title: Overencryption killing interplanetary networks
item.description: Complaints about wide adoption of HTTPS and its design goals
